sub_title: DevOps engineer @ Rabobank | Personal Mission: Famine Alleviation
summary:
I am passionate about Technology Consulting and Famine Alleviation through the means of technology + financial services. 

GOALS:  
- Advance my consulting skills and experience in the DevOps + cloud infrastructure, preferably in the Financial Services
- Alleviate Famine through the means of technology + financial services
- Go on spontaneous road trips on the weekend + spend time with family/ friends + learn something new every day

AREAS OF EXPERTISE:
- Cloud technology: AWS, Google Cloud Platform
- Enterprise architecture modeling: TOGAF and ArchiMate
- Data management/ analytics: Apache Spark, graph database (Knowledge Graph), Tableau

PROFESSIONAL CREDENTIALS (See LinkedIn's Licenses & Professional Certificates section): 
- AWS Cloud Quest Cloud Practitioner
- IBM Data Science Professional Certificate
- Google IT Support Professional Certificate
- Google Compute Engine
- UiPath Certified Advanced Developer (Robotic Process Automation - RPA)

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE (See Linkedin's Experience section):
- Graduation intern @ Accenture Liquid Studio Netherlands: concentrated on Augmented Reality + AWS cloud
- Low-code automation intern @t Abbott Netherlands
- Consulted clients in the Financial Services industry on various projects including process re-engineering and intelligent automation at the global consulting firm Ernst & Young (U.S.-based)

PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES: 
- HTML/ CSS/ JavaScript
- Python
- Java
- R
- SQL
- Spark SQL (distributed computing)
- Java
- C
- VBA 

IDE/ DEVELOPMENT TOOLS:
- AWS
- Google Cloud
- Visual Studio Code
- Android Studio
- RStudio 
- Databricks (Apache Spark - Distributed computing)
- Jupyter notebook
- UiPath RPA (Robotic Process Automation)
- IBM Watson Studio
- Enterprise Studio/ ArchiMate

DATA VISUALIZATION TOOLS:
- Tableau

PROJECT MANAGEMENT TOOLS:
- Jira
- MS Project
- Trello (Kanban board)

CV: https://github.com/kristenphan/kristen-cv.git
Github profile: https://github.com/kristenphan
Data visualization portfolio: https://public.tableau.com/profile/kristen.phan2478#!/
Email address: hgiang.phan@yahoo.com.vn
Phone number (WhatsApp): +31 6 22 86 46 13

treasury_media.description: Proposed a smart city Digital Twin implementation using Dutch Land Registry and Mapping Agency’s Knowledge Graph (KG); KG is a term coined by Google for graph-based data representation model

treasury_media.description: Designed a roadmap for automating the underwriting workflow of a Dutch insurance company called Achmea

treasury_media.description: Modeled the baseline/ target enterprise-wide architecture & an implementation and migration plan for a fictional manufacturing company

treasury_media.title: SuperStore Discount Policy Review with Tableau
treasury_media.description: Created a dynamic Tableau dashboard to identify potential discount policy abuse + highlight opportunities more effective discount policies by analyzing sales data of a fictional company called SuperStore

- Process documentation and analysis: MS Visio

Experience includes:

profile_positions.description:
Collaborate with leadership team and various student organizations on campus to map out the most unconventional development strategies in various aspect including brand awareness, membership recruitment, community involvement, speaking engagements, and participation in regional and national business plan competitions. 

Accomplishments:
•	Meeting turnout grows from 15 in the previous year to over 70 attendees in our most popular events.
•	Host its first Annual 2015 Business Plan Competition with participation of a panel of 15 judges, 4 competing teams, and over 70 attendees on the event day. Spearheaded one of the competing team named Stronix Solutions that came in 1st place. 
•	Be the first and only Richland student organization that sealed the sponsorship deal with Papa John's Pizza in exchange for marketing opportunities with the club.
•	Notable guest speakers at the REC includes CEOs of local businesses, Director of Dallas Regional Chamber of Commerce, Vice President of Southwest Airlines, and many other incredible local entrepreneurs.  
•	Represented Richland College and the REC at the 2016 Alley Scholars Business Plan Competition and won the 4th place.
